channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Japanese Megabank SMFG Got Thrown Out With the Bath Water
item.description: Japanese banks—and SMFG in particular—look attractive after Japan’s stock-market meltdown.

item.title: We're exiting our position in a struggling company with few near-term catalysts
item.description: We'd rather our cash be in companies that are beating expectations and raising guidance.

item.title: A $3 Million Gene-Therapy Maker at a Bargain Price
item.description: Sarepta’s treatment for Duchenne muscular dystrophy should become a blockbuster next year.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks bet big on bundling. Investors want more proof that it's working
item.description: Shares of Palo Alto Networks have been on a tear ahead of Monday's earnings report.

item.title: Coming to a Cash-Strapped Company Near You: Creditor-on-Creditor Violence
item.description: As private-equity-owned companies default, lenders are resorting to measures that seem extreme.

item.title: Alibaba earnings miss expectations despite cloud acceleration
item.description: Alibaba continues to face headwinds in its core e-commerce business amid rising competition and a cautious Chinese consumer.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway Likes Ulta Beauty. Should You?
item.description: There is still a lot to like about the beauty retailer, which has been in the bargain bin since admitting that competitive threats were slowing down its business.

item.title: TikTok and fast-food rivalry fuel Chili's sales as parent Brinker says turnaround is taking hold
item.description: After two years, Brinker International's turnaround of Chili's looks like it's taking hold, as the chain benefits from higher fast-food prices.

item.title: How Inflation and Overspending Are Keeping Gen Z Stuck in a Debt Trap
item.description: A podcast series about how young borrowers got into so much debt so fast and what they can do to manage it.

item.title: DraftKings reverses plans for a tax on customers as FanDuel parent Flutter wows Wall Street
item.description: Earlier this month, DraftKings said it would introduce a surcharge on users in states where taxes on sports betting are highest. FanDuel wouldn't follow suit.
